publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3307 Des McNulty: Victims of Historic Child Abuse—That the Parliament expresses deep concern that many victims of historic child abuse are being denied formal redress through the courts or compensation for the abuse that they suffered while in the care of local government, health authorities and charitable organisations; recognises their anger at the continued barriers that they face in seeking restitution, and calls on the Scottish Government to match the support given to similar victims in other jurisdictions.

S3M-3307 Des McNulty: Victims of Historic Child Abuse—That the Parliament expresses deep concern that many victims of historic child abuse are being denied formal redress through the courts or compensation for the abuse that they suffered while in the care of local government, health authorities and charitable organisations; recognises their anger at the continued barriers that they face in seeking restitution, and calls on the Scottish Government to match the support given to similar victims in other jurisdictions. Supported by: Jack McConnell*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Rhoda Grant*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Marlyn Glen*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) David Whitton*, Michael McMahon*, Jackie Baillie*, Trish Godman*, Bill Butler*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Margaret Curran*, Hugh Henry*, Robin Harper*, James Kelly*, Elaine Murray*, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Dr Richard Simpson* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Mary Mulligan*
S3M-3307 Victims of Historic Child Abuse (lodged on 26 January 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
